data.title: Great Variety
data.text: When we visit South Carolina this is a must for us to grab a sandwhich. I love the turkey with avocado and cucumbers, hits the spot every time. We we make our drive back to Maine we always make the stop the night before for the drive home. It always holds up well. Wish we had one in Maine.

data.title: Good eats.
data.text: Fast service, a good variety, not expensive, easy takeout and they do deliver in a certain mileage range.  If you like sub sandwiches, give them a try.

data.title: really quick delivery and good food
data.text: I like Jimmy Johns because they deliver the food to me. The food comes really quick and is pretty good. I enjoy the regular french bread they offer and the whole grain wheat depending on my mood.

data.title: I am hooked
data.text: I love the number one Pepe sandwich.  The lettuce is piled high and the ham and cheese are great. The bread is really addicting. Convenient location with nice seating area and long bar over looking Main Street.Nice outside eating area as well.Always enjoy being able to refill my drink and the fact that they are so affordable.

data.title: Quite mediocre.
data.text: There was nothing special about this place.  I just went once, to check it out, but I was disappointed in the selections available.

data.title: Average place if you are starving.
data.text: Your average sub shop, although more expensive than Subway.  Probably the easiest place to grab and go a meal in downtown Rock Hill. Service is fast and friendly.

data.title: Good Subs
data.text: I had a BLT and husband had steak sandwich. Bread was fresh and the ingredients were not skimped on. Fist time eating at a Jimmy John's. It hit the spot!

data.title: Freaky Fast Delivery
data.text: I have often ordered delivery from this Jimmy John's location in Rock Hill.  We are only two blocks from the restaurant and the fact that they will deliver just one sandwich is awesome.

data.title: just okay
data.text: The best thing about Jimmy johns is that they deliver.  There subs are not bad  but not great either.  I rather have Penn Station subs any day over Jimmy Johns.  There is nothing really special about their subs.  Just okay

data.title: I'm a fan
data.text: The first time I visitied a Jimmy John's I was not impressed, however that has changed. I want to get a Billy Club with hot peppers every time I pass one now. You can taste everything individually including the bread. I'm definitely a fan now.

data.title: Maybe your sandwich will not be YOUR WAY after all...
data.text:
Not a JJ's regular? Staff at Jimmy John's on Main Street get surly with customers quickly if you do not KNOW your way around the JJ's menu. 

Oh, and DO NOT ASK too many questions!!!

How many are too many? Apparently TWO may be ONE too many! The counter guy will begin to get snarly if you want to deviate from the sandwich contents listed by THE NUMBERED selection... order by the NUMBER if you want him to be happy, not by what you want in YOUR sandwich that would make you happy. A deletion or substitution is unappreciated.

You may have your sandwich on a regular white hoagie roll, or on square (sandwich style) whole wheat sliced bread.

And NO, you may NOT have it heated. Not a JJ's option!

If you want YOUR SANDWICH with contents of YOUR CHOICE...  on your choice of white or wheat hoagie... and heated, YOU WILL fare better going somewhere else.

Plus. JJ's is just a little pricey for what you get. Can you believe there is now a second location open in the shopping center at Herlong and Ebenezer? Wonder if they are more tolerant and address issues other reviews mention... nearly raw bacon and browning lettuce?

data.title: must visit
data.text: Great place to eat. The service was fast. The sandwiches were fresh and enjoyable. I must say that this place has the cleanest bathrooms ever. Look forward to a return visit.

data.title: Best tasting sub-it's all in the bread!
data.text: Jimmy John's has the best tasting sub. It starts with the best tasting sub roll, quality meats, and topped with the freshest ingredients. Fairly priced too!

data.title: Consistent
data.text: Every Jimmy Johns I go to I order the country club sandwich and it was consistent here just like every other Jimmy Johns.  Good work.

data.title: Love JJ!
data.text: I love JJ subs. I usually get the #9 which is the Italian Night Club and it is delicious. Unfortunately, I cannot remember what exactly comes on it to be put it in this review but trust me, it's yummy! The only downside to this JJ location is it's not easy to access. It's located downtown and there's limited parking so you may have to park far away and walk to it which is not so bad. Also, the music they play in the restaurant is a little loud and they could definitely turn that down a few notches. Other than that, it's great. They offer subs, sandwiches and wraps. They have the most delicious BBQ chips that remind me of kettle chips. Prices in sandwiches range from $3.75-5.75.

data.title: Great sandwiches!
data.text: We (9 of us, from 18 mos through adult) went for lunch after church.  It wasn't great for the little one, but the rest of us loved our sandwiches.  Limited menu- sandwiches, chips, cookies... but that's what we wanted.  Great bread, plenty of filling, friendly people.  We'll be back!  Delivery area is very small...

data.title: Be sure to give this place a try.
data.text: My husband and I went to Jimmy John's for the first time tonight. We were greeted by the person behind the counter almost immediately, which was nice.  Sandwiches are priced anywhere from $3.75 (for Plain Slims) to $7.75 ( for The JJ Gargantuan).  The bread was fresh, the food was very good and the service was fast. The sandwiches are not as fat as the subs from Subway, but they are 8" instead of 6". Also, they have a choice of seating inside or out. We both enjoyed the food and will eat here in again in the future.
